item.title: My Smart Home Setup
item.description: What smart appliances do I have Washing machine Drying machine Robot vacuum cleaner Air purifier Air moisturiser TVs ?!?

item.title: Learning Multiple New Technologies at the Same Time
item.description: Intro Learning multiple new technologies may prove to be a challenge. Recently for a new project that I have been assigned to I was in a situation where I had to learn multiple new “tricks” in timely manner. The good thing was THE BUSINESS was on the same page - without first building the sufficient knowledge - we could not deliver what they wanted. This is actually my most important advice - if you or your team are required to do some project involving tech you have no working experience with - have a discussion with the stakeholder and clearly state tnat you will need time to get accounted with tech and plan for it.

item.title: Time to Choose the New Project Tech Stack
item.description: Intro At a team lead it is my responsibility (coordinated with the company’s wide technical experience and architects) to choose the new project tech stack. I am the kind of a person that would go with the screaming edge tech just for the rush of experience something new and making my everyday developer life more interesting. However from practical point of view, as the project(integration with a major odds supplier) that we are about to create is somewhat crucial for the business I do not have that liberty and I have to stick with a modern, but proven technologies.
